meanings.definition: A device used for transmitting facsimile images over a distance.
meanings.sent1: The telefacsimile in the office helps send important documents quickly.
meanings.sent2: I received a telefacsimile from the remote office with the contract details.
meanings.sent3: The telefacsimile machine seemed to have a mind of its own, sending random pictures.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a telefacsimile, transmitting warmth and joy across the room.
meanings.sent5: The telefacsimile hummed softly as it worked, sending out copies effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The process of transmitting facsimile images over a distance.
meanings.sent1: We use telefacsimile to quickly share sketches with our team members.
meanings.sent2: The telefacsimile of the blueprint arrived just in time for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: During the telefacsimile transmission, the image turned into a funny cartoon.
meanings.sent4: His words were a telefacsimile of comfort, reaching me even from afar.
meanings.sent5: The telefacsimile of the sunset painted a beautiful scene on the paper.
